name: SpringHill Suites Anchorage University Lake

reviews.text: There's nothing better than a new hotel and this property is no exception. Clean, modern, trendy; very well appointed. Designed for the guest.
reviews.title: Almost perfect....read why business travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious. The separated bathroom with a large walk in glass shower/sink and another close-able space for the toilet is a very nice touch. Channel line up very nice.
reviews.title: Great Suites

reviews.text: The hotel spaces are very trendy. The hot breakfast offers many choices and is a very open and accommodating space. The property is nestled near a beautiful lake that has dog walk trails all near a university.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, friendly staff

reviews.text: So now the few minuses. 1) Location is a two edged sword. If you are a business traveler that likes to be close if not walking distance to dining options you're out of luck. Sure there's a Subway and a taco spot kinda close but if a waited menu spot is your idea for a evening wind down you'll be driving for 5-10 minutes to eat.
reviews.title: Loved the rooms!

reviews.text: 2) Room Internet. I stayed 4 days at this hotel. Although it can have its occasional moments for the most part it's too slow and unreliable. At times web pages pages would just fail to load. I realize this is Alaska but I have had far better internet service in Juneau hotels. If decent/reliable in room internet is important for your business trip you won't be happy. Hopefully the management reads this and makes adjustments. "High speed" should not be in the service's description.
reviews.title: Beautiful modern hotel rooms, fantastic use of space!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one night in June. The hotel is right next to the lake, and from our room we can see the lake and snow mountains. The room is new and pleasant. Breakfast is nice as well.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one night at the Spring Hill Suites at University Lake after a late flight into Anchorage. This was the perfect choice. The hotel staff very friendly and accommodating. The hotel was about a 10 minute drive from the airport. It was close by, but not right at the airport. The hotel rooms were new, clean, and modern with updated features such as an I Pod dock on the bedside table. We were pleasantly surprised by their breakfast spread, which included assorted cereals, bagels, English muffins, donuts, pastries, warm biscuits with gravy, scrambled eggs with cheese, and even a “make your own waffle” station. I highly recommend the Spring Hill Suites at University Lake if you will be staying over in the Anchorage area.
reviews.title: New and clean with modern features
I Really Enjoyed This Place
reviews.text: Although the Spring Hill Suites is a budget level Marriott, I really enjoyed this one.
The hotel is right on a lake and is refreshingly calm. Staff is helpful and accommodating. I loved sitting around the fire pit.
reviews.title: Greatness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is only a few years old. It is a little out of the way
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel in ANC

reviews.text: I stayed here for 1 week in March 2012. I was very impressed with the quality of the property and of the staff. The location is also superb as it sits on a lake with a walking trail.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay for any type of travel

reviews.text: I stayed here with two kids and we took full advantage of the pool. A small complaint might be that a couple of times in the pool the chlorine was a bit much. The water could have been slightly warmer as well.
reviews.title: Lovely location - Good breakfast

reviews.text: Breakfast was ample and standard hotel fare.
reviews.title: A-ok place to stay but....the coffee is weak; pool is dinky

reviews.text: One of the best things about the hotel is that it is Native Alaska owned.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Choice for Relax

reviews.text: I stayed here for 8 days on a business trip. The room is very modern, think Ikea. The separate "rooms" for the toilet and shower were weird, but served their purpose well enough. As someone else noted, no matter what you do, the water in the shower will leak out onto the floor. They do have a really good free breakfast, better than most. Frankly whenever there is a fairly decent hot breakfast, you've won me over. The hotel sits on university lake and there is a really pretty one mile trail aound the perimeter. I went walking around the lake everyday and saw moose on the trail all but two of those days. My only complaint lies in the people around me. My neighbors to my immediate right screamed at their kids non stop and the neighbors across the hall actually ended up with the police banging on their door due to screaming. I guess the take away is, sound proof doors may be a good investment for this hotel as all of the guests like to scream at each other.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I started staying at this hotel just after it opened. The hotel is on a lake, near the hospitals, UAA and APU. The staff is very good and helpful, rooms are clean.
reviews.title: Great Place and Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you don't need to be downtown Anchorage this is the place to stay
reviews.title: Outstanding, Courteous and Friendly Service from All Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for seven days ending August 4th and used it as a base for taking multiple day trips to various parts of southern Alaska.
reviews.title: Wonderful... Great service

reviews.text: In one word, I would describe the service during our stay as SUPERIOR. It was far beyond what we would have expected from a full service Marriott. We were able to use the shuttle for transportation to and from the airport, to and from downtown, and to pick up a rental car. The service at the front desk was courteous and friendly from each of the individuals we interacted with.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, we would go back

reviews.text: The daily breakfast was really a full breakfast, not a continental one and coffee and tea was available 24 hours a day. The setting added to our experience being located on a lake with fish and beavers occupying it with a 1+ mile jogging/hiking trail completely encircling the lake.
reviews.title: Two pleasant stays at this hotel

reviews.text: We had read the reviews and hoped this would be a nice place, but were blown away by how much we liked it. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is quite new and it shows. Well-designed large rooms feature an efficient layout and are furnished with beautiful bed(s), large desk, office chair, pull-out sofa, very large bureau with drawers, and flat-screen TV on a stand with more storage space. Rooms also has a walk-in closet, and split bath (shower & sink with large counter in one room, toilet and sink with small counter in a separate area). There is an alcove with frig & coffee maker. Rooms are spacious and decorated in a soothing, cool palette. Lots of extra blankets and pillows in the closet. You can set the room temperature yourself. Everything is in great shape - very clean, most of it still seems brand new.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property features a terrific outdoor patio with gas fire pit, lovely flowers, tables/chairs, and a wide trail leading to the nearby lake. The rooms facing east have an amazing lake/mountain view.
reviews.title: Great hotel excellent service

reviews.text: There is a nice-sized indoor pool & well-equipped exercise room.
reviews.title: Great hotel with contemporary design.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: We spent 3 nights here and couldn't have been more pleased.

reviews.text: The staff was top notch - always helpful & friendly. They kept the breakfast area clean and replenished. The hotel is not in downtown Anchorage, but there is a shuttle that goes to the airport or takes you to downtown Anchorage. This is the first time we made special requests at booking that were honored when we checked in. We requested a 3rd floor room with a lake view and a room without down. When we checked in they had the type of room we requested ready and the head of house keeping immediately came up to the room and changed out the feather pillows/comforter for us (due to allergies).
reviews.title: A nice place to stay

reviews.text: I thought the price was a little high considering we weren't right in downtown Anchorage. But prices tend to be high in the Summer and it is a nice clean hotel and the free breakfast is pretty good.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The only thing my husband didn't like was there is a glass wall separating the pool area from the exercise room.
reviews.title: Loved the Place!

reviews.text: Beautiful trail and lake behind hotel, complete with back deck and fire pit that is nice to have dinner around.
reviews.title: Great Place and Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds were nice, everything was clean, nice bathrooms and showers.
reviews.title: Off the beaten Path Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in this hotel 2 times, the first being for around 24 days or so and the second for 14 days. There customer service was great and the hotel was very clean and well kept. The shuttle service is exceptional, we got stuck waiting over an hour and a half for our cab, we called the hotel and the shuttle was there within 5 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: great stay!

reviews.text: Overall, its a nice hotel, but not family friendly. The breakfast closes at 9am ! I think its ok for business customers, but not for family. While we were there, I saw so many families coming at 9/9:30 and to their surprise, no breakfast ! And the kitchen was closed !
reviews.title: Nice hotel - but not family friendly

reviews.text: Luckily I asked the time when we checked in and had to drag my sleepy kids down at 8:30am.
reviews.title: Don't leave anything

reviews.text: This was our third time staying here. I loved this place the first two times we stayed here. This time we arrived 7 hours late due to a delayed plane. IT was late and they put us in room 201. There is not a bathtub in this room :O( but it was late, we were tired, so we just unpacked and went to bed. The next morning the sink's faucet handle in the shower area came off in our hands. We told them at breakfast, and I did not go back into that area of the bathrooms. We left to go on to Talkeetna, and as we unpacked that night I noticed my make-up case was missing. We called Spring HIll the next morning and asked if they had found it, and to hold it until we came back on Friday. The lady on the phone kept saying we had a bad connection and finally hung up. The first thing we asked when we arrived on Friday was where the make=up case was. The desk clerk (who was the one I spoke with on the phone) went to the back and got the case (in a plastic bag). I opened it and noticed my pill box was missing along with one of those little silk jewelry pouches. I said something immediately. She said was I sure, I said I would check my carry on again, but I was pretty sure. Went to the room and checked all our luggage-nothing! Went back down and said it was not there. Asked if they had drug addicts on the staff as I had Vicodin and Tramadol and some over the counter sleeping pills in the pill case that was missing. I got blank stares. I was told they would look again-I asked again on Saturday and they called the housekeeper. She would not look at me and said they found nothing. Those items WERE in the make-up case when it was in the room, so who has them now???? This concerns me. Luckily there was no expensive jewelry in the pouch.
reviews.title: Premium friendliness

reviews.text: I had never stayed at a SpringHill Suites Hotel. I loved the modern yet welcoming feel of the lobby. My room was very well designed and had a beautiful view of the lake. The staff could not have been friendlier, front desk, housekeeping, and shuttle bus drivers.
reviews.title: Nice place but beware of the sports schedule

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very clean and spacious. We loved the separate seating area as well as the separate toilet and bathroom. Breakfast was very nice with lots of choices. We had a hire car and the location suited us.
reviews.title: Fabulous rooms

reviews.text: We stayed here mainly because of other TripAdvisor reviews and because of the pictures of the surroundings. My family (myself, husband and 3 kids ranging in age from teens to early twenties) came to Anchorage for a vacation. We were traveling frequently on Highway 1, so the hotel was convenient for us. If you are a business traveler and needed to be in downtown Anchorage frequently, this might not be the place for you. The hotel is in beautiful surroundings!! It sits on a lake with a view of the mountains and is probably the most popular dog park in the city. There is also a family of beavers that live on the lake. There is a nice walking trail that goes all the way around - remember your mosquito repellant!! Two queen beds were very comfortable, but my son who "drew the sort straw!" and slept on the sofa said it was not comfortable at all. You could feel every spring in the very thin sofa mattress. Room seemed smaller than it appeared in the picture, but we didn't come to Alaska to hang out in the room, so.... Housekeeping was accommodating though we had to track them down every single day. They never seemed to get that we had 5 people in the room and consistently only left us 3 towels - not a big deal, and one easily rectified. The bathroom is nicely arranged for a family - sink and toilet in one room and next to it another sink and then shower!! It was very convenient for us when we were all trying to get ready at the same time!! Breakfast at a hotel with a family of 5 is a must for us!! The breakfast was plentiful and tasted very good. Assortment of juices, coffee, tea and milk was offered. Also yogurt, oatmeal, fresh fruit, make your own waffles, eggs and sausage/bacon, and pastries, muffins and bagels. Pretty sure that will be our one and only trip to Anchorage, but I would have no qualms about staying here again!!
reviews.title: The surroundings are beautiful!

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel twice during my visit to Anchorage. My trip was booked that way before I went. On my first visit the room was on the parking lot side where there's not really a view. But it was on the third floor so there was no stomping overhead. The University has a very loud clock which chimes a lot and plays various tunes (including Beatles hits) ALL THE TIME. It doesn't stop at night. This is irritating if you want the window open to let air in. The windows open nice and wide and have double mosquito protection, which was excellent.
reviews.title: Stay on the lake side

reviews.text: The first room had a large shower. The toilet and shower are split, although both rooms have a sink. The sliding doors provide no soundproofing, so if you are sharing I hope you know your roomy well.
reviews.title: Nicest stay in Anchorage - Willy Wonka's Pick

reviews.text: The beds could do with a little more bedding, we had to ring down for extra blankets during both stays.
reviews.title: Charming

aka: Springhill Suites Anchorage University Lake Hotel Anchorage
description: Discover a different kind of hotel with style and space, beautifully priced.Beautiful lakefront lodging with mountain views, in town. Featuring separate areas for sleeping, eating and working, SpringHill Suites provides guests with a microwave, mini-fridge, desk and pull-out sofa bed. Enjoy complimentary continental breakfast and airport shuttle, as well as pool, whirlpool, exercise room and wireless.
